sources.full: One Shot Wonders - 10 Forest One Shot Adventures

data.name: Light the Way
entries: ADVENTUROUS - DELIVERY - FOREST ROAD

Highway robbers are targeting travellers passing through a particularly dense, dark area of the forest. The council have commissioned a number of lamp posts to try and make the road safer. The final stage of installation requires placing glowing insects inside the lanterns.

"The council have employed you as temporary contractors, after an engineering project ran over schedule and the regular workers were moved on to another job. The workers were able to construct five metal lamp posts, each with a hanging glass lantern. However, they weren't able to install the glowing Giant Fire Beetles that provide the illumination."

entries.name: Suggested Story
entries: Set the scene, have Faulin explain the job and ask the party to sign a contract, then continue:
{@b Terms of Employment}

items: Faulin gives the party a map of the forest. The five lamp posts that need lighting are neatly marked.
Faulin shows the party to a cart that holds a crate of six {@creature Giant Fire Beetle||Giant Fire Beetles}, two spare glass lanterns and a stack of bounty posters to pin up.

entries: {@b Into the Dark}

items: Lamp 1: A {@creature Swarm of Wasps} are nesting within it; they must be removed before the lantern can be lit.
Lamp 2: A {@creature Giant Bat} attacks the {@creature Giant Fire Beetle}.
Lamp 3: The lamp post has been vandalised. The party must fix it, including replacing the lantern.
Lamp 4: This {@creature Giant Fire Beetle} is especially vicious!

entries: {@b Stand and Deliver}

items: Lamp 5: The party are ambushed by Tilde and Gregor, accompanied by two {@creature Mastiff||Mastiffs}. If the party subdue the robbers, they can take them back to the council offices and claim the reward.

entries: {@b Faulin Gawa}
{@i Human, Non-Binary, 52 ({@creature Commoner})}
Efficient Faulin explains the terms of the work in detail, reading from their clipboard at top speed.
{@b Tilde Krilheim}
{@i Human-Elf, Female, 34 ({@creature Tough|XMM})}
Forceful Tilde often bosses Gregor around. She carries a chunky crossbow and mace with ease.
{@b Gregor Hizzlefett}
{@i Halfling, Male, 34 ({@creature Bandit})}
While Tilde stands and confronts travellers, Gregor sneaks to flank them and cut off their escape.

entries.name: Key Locations
entries: {@b Forest Path}

Most of the underbrush enjoys dappled sunshine, apart from an area of dense pines. The thickest part of the forest is shaded in darkness, so the party will need the ability to see in the dark or an alternative light source to guide their way.
{@b Lamp Posts}

Each lamp post is made of twisting metal poles and is 10 ft tall. A tear-shaped, glass lantern hangs on a curved hook at the top of each post. The base of each lantern can be opened to insert the {@creature Giant Fire Beetle}. It shuts with a latch and padlock.

items: The bounty posters offer a 75gp reward for anyone who delivers the two highway robbers to stand trial.
Tilde and Gregor want to destroy the lamp posts, as it is easier for them to attack from the shadows.
The council workers who installed the empty lamp posts were delayed by the robbers' sabotage efforts.
Each lantern comfortably houses a {@creature Giant Fire Beetle}, who will be regularly tended to by forest rangers.

entries.name: Quest Rewards
entries: Faulin will pay the party 10gp per lamp post they are able to get up-and-running, and the council will pay the 75gp bounty if Tilde and Gregor are handed into the authorities. If searched, Gregor has a Spell Scroll ({@spell Guidance}) stuffed into his back pocket.

entries.name: Level Changes
entries: {@b Harder}: A grumpy {@creature Brown Bear} could be using a lamp post to scratch itself. Gregor could also be a {@creature Touch|XMM}.
{@b Even Harder}: Two {@creature Phase Spider||Phase Spiders} could attack during the journey. There could be three {@creature Bandit Captain||Bandit Captains} as robbers.

images.title: Light the Way - Dense Forest - Sparse (Grid)
Light the Way - Dense Forest Sparse (Gridless)

data.name: Too Many Cooks
entries: THRILLING - ESCAPE - SECLUDED CAMP

The party are kidnapped by three bickering Gnoll siblings and made to cook for their captors. Should the party decline, they might just become ingredients themselves! Another prisoner has a plan to break free, but can the group escape without rousing the Gnolls' suspicions?

entries.name: Starting the Adventure
entries: {@i "The wicker baskets that you carry are somewhat cumbersome, but nothing is going to get you down on this beautiful, sunny walk through the forest. Couriering these pumpkins to the next village is the easiest coin you've ever made. Until, suddenly, you are jerked into the air, the world flips upside down and the pumpkins go tumbling to the ground."}

entries.name: KEZRIN 'KEZ' MUZZLEMAW
entries: GNOLL, MALE, 29 ({@creature GNOLL})
Tired of his younger siblings' bad cooking, Kez came up with the idea of capturing some helpers.
{@i "Amidst the jewellery hanging around the Gnoll's muscular neck, you see a metallic key."}

entries.name: RODREE FENCHURCH
entries: HUMAN, MALE, 45 ({@creature ACOLYTE})
Rodree is a hiker who was captured by the {@creature Gnoll||Gnolls} three days ago; he has limited healing abilities.
{@i "Beneath his chains, the bruises on his wrists are a painful mix of purple and yellow."}

entries.name: Suggested Story
entries: Set the scene, have the party test their strength to see if they can get out of the nets, then continue:

items: As the party dangle in the air, trying to get free, {@creature Gnoll||Gnolls} appear and ruthlessly knock the party out.

The party wake up in a cage with Rodree, chainedup in pairs. Rodree asks for help with his escape plan. He has seen toxic berries by the river, where he is forced to catch fish for dinner every evening. He plans to get berries and feed them to the {@creature Gnoll||Gnolls}.
The {@creature Gnoll||Gnolls} order the party to make pumpkin soup for lunch. Impressive cooking will make the {@creature Gnoll||Gnolls} less suspicious of the party at dinner time.

Later, the group are ordered to catch and prepare fish; some of them can try to distract the {@creature Gnoll||Gnolls} and others can gather the berries. When making dinner, the group can try to sneak the berries in.
With the {@creature Gnoll||Gnolls} weakened, the party can unchain themselves using Kez's key, grab their confiscated weapons and fight their way to freedom.

entries.name: Key Locations
entries: GNOLL CAMP–A small, central fire with a cauldron is neighboured by three leafy, muddy patches where the {@creature Gnoll||Gnolls} sit, eat and sleep when at the campsite.
The party are placed in a sturdy, bamboo cage, next to a makeshift, wooden table used for preparing meals.
RIVER–A scenic river on the forest's edge. The party can use nets to fish for salmon, and collect berries.
Eating one berry reduces a Gnoll's AC by 3; eating two berries reduces damage a {@creature Gnoll} deals by half; three gives a Gnoll the poisoned condition. All effects stack.

entries.name: Secrets and Clues

items: Kez's two younger siblings are twins named Bodrik and Gutrig. Kez enjoys bossing both of them around.
To make soup, the party need to chop the pumpkins into even cubes, boil them with water, and season.
To cook the fish, the party must remove the scales, gut them and fillet them, then grill them on the fire.
Black elkbane berries grow on shrubs with sharp spikes. Each plant only bears two to three berries.

entries: {@b Level 1 - 2}
{@b HARDER}: The {@creature Gnoll||Gnolls} could use {@creature Bugbear} stats, and the salmon could be a dangerous {@creature Swarm of Quippers}.
{@b EVEN HARDER}: The {@creature Gnoll||Gnolls} could be scavenging {@creature Wererat||Wererats} who want to eat {@creature Giant Elk} instead of salmon.

data.name: Surprise Guests
entries: THRILLING - DEFENCE - ANCIENT TEMPLE

Fey and mortals have gathered together to celebrate a coming-of-age ceremony for a child, who will one day control an area of forest that bridges the two worlds. However, a distant relative wants to usurp that power for herself, and will disrupt the midnight ceremony to do so.

"Tonight, we gather under the light of the moon to celebrate the dedication of one young soul to the responsibilities she will one day inherit. As is custom, we are joined by strangers from the mortal realm, to stand as witnesses for their world and as a symbol of the continued goodwill between us. We thank them for accepting our invitation tonight..."

entries.name: Suggested Story
entries: Set the scene, have Tirrna give a speech to begin the coming-of-age ceremony, then continue:
{@b Vows Interrupted}

items: The party are asked to each present an item as a sentimental offering, and receive a flower in return.
As Rayne begins her vows, candles flicker out and multiple Guards fall down into a magical slumber.
Tirrna instructs the guests to retreat into a lower sanctum. She asks the party to stand guard while her Centaur bodyguard, Germail, aids the guests.

entries: {@b Ceremony Under Siege}

items: Waves of foes drop from the rafters and begin combat. Wave 1: two Swarms of Bats; Wave 2: two Darkmantles; and Wave 3: two Gargoyles.

entries: {@b Raising an Objection}

items: Nimh emerges at the altar from the Ethereal Plane, and demands the right to the title. As the party try to fend Nimh off, Tirrna, Rayne and Germail run over to help subdue her.
Once Nimh is stopped, Tirrna thanks the party, and the ceremony resumes outside in the forest.

entries: {@b Marquise Tirrna Miadonis}
{@i Drow, Female, 364 (Drow)}
A fey noble who hopes her child will continue her policy of peace with the adjoining mortal lands.
{@b Rayne Miadonis}
{@i Drow, Female, 16 (Drow)}
Sixteen-year-old Rayne is old enough to make the vows needed to be recognised as her mother's heir.
{@b Nimh Miadonis}
{@i Drow, Female, 412 (Night Hag)}
Nimh is Tirrna's second cousin and was in line for her title until Rayne became part of the family.

entries.name: Key Locations
entries: {@b Miadonis Grove}

The ancestral lands of the Miadonis family are an area of fey forest where the border with the mortal realm is particularly thin. Nimh wants to return to the old ways of their family, tricking and exploiting mortals who enter fey territory.
{@b Ancient Temple}

The ceremony venue is a small building. The dedication book sits on a central altar, in front of a flight of stairs leading to a lower sanctum. Moonlight trickles through stained-glass windows, but the high ceiling rafters are shrouded in darkness.

items: The party were pulled through a portal in an oak tree to attend the ceremony on behalf of all mortals.
During the ceremony, Rayne will sign her name into a magical book, which seals her inheritance.
Once Rayne's name is inscribed in the book, Nimh will face exile if she acts against her young cousin.
In a Drow lifespan, 16 is extremely young, so Rayne is unlikely to inherit the title for many years.

entries.name: Quest Rewards
entries: For saving the ceremony, Tirrna bestows a special fey blessing (Aid) upon the party that lasts for the next 24 hours. She also gives them a small topaz heirloom gem (worth 500gp) presented in a velvet-lined chest.

entries.name: Level Changes
entries: {@b Easier}
You could remove the Gargoyles from the attack in the temple, and Nimh could use Cultist Fanatic stats.
{@b Harder}
Try adding a Gargoyle into both Waves 1 and 2, then two Will-o'-Wisps into Wave 3. Nimh could be a Drider.

images.title: Light the Way - Dense Forest - Sparse (Grid)
Light the Way - Dense Forest Sparse (Gridless)

data.name: Foes in the Foliage
entries: ADVENTUROUS - DEFENCE - RAINFOREST CLEARING

Deep in the rainforest, a local Druid has identified a tree that will soon awaken into a powerful, sentient Treant. Knowing a group of territorial Dryads will do whatever it takes to stop the transformation, the Druid has hired the party to protect the sacred sapling from harm.

entries.name: Starting the Adventure

entries: "Every inch of the forest is teeming with life. You can hear it in the buzz and whine of tiny insects that whizz past your ears, and in the distant roar of larger predators that lurk in the undergrowth. You can even smell it in the humid air. The druid who hired you asked you to meet him near a patch of fenced-off bromeliad flowers; you spotted the landmark about an hour ago, but are yet to see any sign of him"

The wildlife of the rainforest traditionally live under the benevolent stewardship of a powerful Treant. However, in the decades since the last Treant guardian passed away, a group of territorial Dryads have risen to become the dominant force in the forest. With a new Treant on the verge of awakening, the Dryads have hatched a plot to poison it before it has a chance to emerge. The party have been summoned by a Druid, who is set on protecting this tree, after failing to save a potential Treant in the past.

entries.name: Suggested Story
entries: Set the scene, have Lycaster walk out from the forest and give the party their task, then continue:
{@b Home Invasion}

items: Lycaster takes the party to his shelter to collect supplies, but they find it has been ransacked.
Maps leading to the Treant have been stolen, and healing tinctures needed to protect it are smashed. The party must recover herbs and vials from within.

entries: {@b Healing Waters}

items: Lycaster needs to fetch a key ingredient to help make more tincture  water from a magical flower. The party must climb a tree to find it, avoiding a deadly Giant Constrictor Snake in the branches.
With the water, Lycaster can make enough tincture for each player and himself to carry one dose.
Lycaster leads the group to the emerging Treant.

entries: {@b Hold the Line}

items: As night falls, the Dryads attack in five waves:

Wave 1: Two Dryads step out of trees; Wave 2: a Dryad appears with a Panther under its control; Wave 3: two Dryads drop down from the treetops; Wave 4: three Dryads appear and try to charm a party member; Wave 5: Helabor appears, flanked by two Dryads and two more Panthers.
Each Dryad tries to poison the tree. The tree can only take three doses of poison until it dies, but a dose of tincture nullifies a dose of poison. The tree will turn into a Treant after five rounds.
If awakened, Pona the Treant thanks the group and helps to attack any remaining Dryads.
When the danger passes, Lycaster gratefully thanks and pays the party.

entries: {@b Lycaster Cedrela}
{@i Human-Elf, Male, 95 (Druid)}
Lycaster is dedicated to preserving natural cycles within the forest, including the transfer of power.
"It is hard to tell where Lycaster ends and the forest begins. Colourful lichen grows over his clothing, helping him blend into the trees."
{@b Helabor Cattleya}
{@i Dryad, Female, 304 (Dryad)}
A highly trained warrior and spy, dead set on destroying Lycaster's store of healing tinctures.
"Pink and white orchids weave amongst the vibrant vines tumbling down her bark-like skin. She steps with a soft, but deadly, grace."
{@b Pona}
{@i Treant, Female, 150 (Treant)}
Prior to her awakening, she existed for 150 years as an unassuming mahogany tree.
"The tree's bark warps and settles into a kind face with soft eyes and an expressive smile."

entries.name: Key Locations
entries: {@b Lycaster's Shelter}
"The small shelter was hidden, but clearly not well enough. Smashed clay containers lie on the floor, with liquid seeping out of them. There is a strong smell of rotting plants."

Lycaster's humble forest home is entirely made of natural materials. Helabor ransacked the shelter, she also released toxins into the air. When inhaled, the toxins act as if a Poison Spray spell has been cast.
{@b Treetops}
"The tree boughs look strong, but they're slick with moss and moisture. Any climbers would need to be very careful to not plummet back to the forest floor."

The magical plant is bright-orange and easy to spot. Water collects in the petals, along with tiny frogs and tadpoles who swim in the small pools of shimmering liquid. The plant only grows in the highest branches, 20 ft above the ground.
{@b Emerging Treant}
"The strong, proud tree is draped with vines, and many colourful birds are perched on its sturdy branches. Even amidst all the other life in this rainforest, this tree seems to exert a special draw."
The tree is teaming with arcane energy, just waiting to awaken. As she emerges, Ponas branches extend into long fingertips and her trunk splits into two huge legs.

items: The stolen maps had footnotes on Treant biology, and an estimation of when it would emerge.
The Dryads' herbicide uses a base of rootrot fungus, which is extremely toxic to plant life.
Helabor found the location of Lycaster's shelter by tracking the animals that visit him for food.
The Dryads see Lycaster as meddlesome, but not as significant a threat as an awakened Treant.
The Treant is vulnerable to poison in the moments before it emerges, as its magic briefly weakens.
The last time a Treant was about to awaken, the Dryads poisoned it, causing it to wither and die.

entries.name: Quest Rewards
entries: Lycaster offers the party 150gp to defend him and the awakening tree. If Pona awakens, Lycaster gifts the party an additional 100gp, and a bubbling Potion of Animal Friendship that he is able to brew for them back at his shelter.

entries.name: Level Changes
entries: {@b Easier}
You could only have one Dryad present in each wave, and remove the Panthers from the fight.
{@b Harder}
Some of the Dryads could ride into battle on saddled Tigers; and Helabor could instead be a Green Hag who wants to rule the rainforest.
